articles.title: [개인정보 다이어트 ②] 기억 안 나는 가입 내역, ‘개인정보 포털’에서 한눈에 찾자
articles.description: 개인정보보호 포털, 본인확인 내역 일괄 조회 및 웹사이트 탈퇴 지원 서비스 제공 ‘탈퇴 신청 불가’ 사이트는 직접 방문하거나 관리자 문의 필요해ID·PW 유출 확인하는 ‘다크웹 조회’ 병행해야... 간편 가입 내역은 별도 관리 필수[보안뉴스 조재호 기자] ‘개인정보 다이어트’의 핵심은 내가 어디에 가입했는지 아는 것에서 시작한다. 수많은 웹사이트에 가입하고
articles.summary: 기사는 개인정보 포털에서 가입한 내역을 복구하고자 하는 경우를 다루어, 관리자 문의 대상이지만, '다크웹 조회'사용에 유의사거나 ID·PW 보호가능성을 강elye하게 강박.
points: 개인정보보호 포털이 직접 방문한 경우 아니면 ID·PW를 보호해주는 '다크웹 조회'으로 변경 요청
관리자 문의가 필요하다는 제on록 인증컨트랤스를 반드시 수동으로 구현해야 한다.
이 기사는 '다크웹 조회'와 ID·PW 보호 서비스가 IT/기술 업계에서의 중요성을 강불한다.
articles.insight: 이 뉴스는 IT/기술 업계가 ID·PW 보호와 '다크웹 조회'서비스의 중요성에 대해 주장하고 있고, 이로써 직접 참조되는 관련 전문가에게 유의어를 드리고자 한다.

articles.title: Why Silicon Valley is really talking about fleeing California (it’s not the 5%)
articles.description: If you’ve been following the billionaire exodus from California with some confusion, here’s what’s actually driving the nervousness: it’s not the 5% rate. As highlighted Friday in the New York Post, the proposed wealth tax would hit founders on their voting shares rather than the actual equity they own. Take Larry Page, who about 3% […]
articles.summary: The article discusses misconceptions around Silicon Valley's billionaire exodus from California due to the proposed wealth tax that would impact founders on their voting shares rather than actual equity ownership.
points: California is considering a progressive, graduated wealth and income-based levy of between one percent and nine per cent for individuals with incomes over $1 million annually. In effect the tax would target Silicon Valley's tech elite including Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg.

The proposed bill has created a stir among California billionaires, leading to discussions about potential relocation of businesses and personal fortunes outside of California in response to perceived economic disincentives.
Silicon Valley founders have been vocalizing their concerns regarding the wealth tax proposal as they worry that it may affect investment decisions due to its impact on ownership stakes.
articles.insight: The proposed progressive wealth and income-based levy in California, targeting Silicon Valley tech elite's significant earnings and assets without considering the implications of disincentivizing capital investments. The tax policy may lead to a potential relocation trend among these billionaires.

articles.title: Who gets to inherit the stars? A space ethicist on what we’re not talking about
articles.description: While it's easy to romanticize space as an escape to a pristine frontier where people will float weightlessly among the stars, it’s worth remembering there are no oceans or mountains or chirpy birds in space. It's “not nice up there,” said Rubenstein. “It is not nice at all."
articles.summary: Rubenstein discusses the less-discussed aspects of a potential future in space where humans may live and work among stars. The article touches on ethical considerations that could arise from such a venture.
points: The allure of living amongst the stars is romanticized, often ignoring its harsh realities like 'it's not nice at all'.
Space exploration and habitation raise complex ethical questions that are currently underexplored in public discourse.
Rubenstein highlights a gap between popular imagination of space travel and the grim reality, suggesting deeper implications for how we approach off-planet living.
articles.insight: The article suggests that before engaging with discussions on colonizing or inhabiting other planets, society must first confront and resolve ethical issues related to such endeavors in space exploration. It indicates a need for more inclusive dialogue regarding the potential impacts of off-planet living.

articles.title: Trump administration’s legal setbacks are good news for offshore wind — and the grid
articles.description: Three offshore wind projects under construction on the U.S. East Coast are back to building after judges rebuked the Department of the Interior's actions.
articles.summary: Judges have ruled against legal challenges by opponents of three offshore wind projects on U.S. East Coast, allowing them to continue construction.
points: Offshore wind energy development in the United States faces lesser opposition due to recent judicial decisions
Projects at Block Island Wind Farm and those planned for Vineyard Sound are back in operation after legal setbacks
The rulings indicate a positive shift towards renewable energies despite resistance from traditional sectors
articles.insight: These decisions may signal an increasing acceptance of offshore wind energy as part of the country's broader transition to sustainable power sources, potentially influencing future projects and policies.

articles.title: Oshen built the first ocean robot to collect data in a Category 5 hurricane
articles.description: Oshen has signed contracts with multiple government agencies for its C-Star robots to collect ocean data autonomously.
articles.summary: Following the devastation of Hurricane Dorian in The Bahamas and destruction across Florida due to three consecutive hurricanes in August-October '20, Oshen is deploying its C-Star robots contracted by government agencies for autonomous ocean data collection during Category 5 storms.
points: Oshen has signed multiple agreements with various federal and state governments to utilize their fleet of C-Star underwater robotic vehicles in collecting crucial marine data autonomously, particularly from the Atlantic Ocean' extramyriatic waters during extreme weather conditions like hurricanes.

The company plans to operate these robots within dangerous zones that are usually out of reach for humans due to the hazardous sea and atmospheric environments present around Category 5 storms, thus aiming at collecting unprecedented data about undersea conditions during such disasters.
In addition to providing vital information regarding oceanographic events linked with hurricanes like upwellings of deep water rich in nutrients and plankton that affect local ecology,
articles.insight: The development by Oshen could potentially revolutionize disaster management efforts, particularly for severe weather conditions such as Category 5 storms where data collection has been a significant challenge.

articles.title: Musk wants up to $134B in OpenAI lawsuit, despite $700B fortune
articles.description: Musk's legal team argues he should be compensated as an early startup investor who sees returns "many orders of magnitude greater" than his initial investment.
articles.summary: Elon Musk is seeking up to $134 billion in the OpenAI lawsuit despite owning a net worth exceeding $250 billion.
points: Musk's legal team argues he should be compensated for early startup investment returns that are significantly higher than his initial stake.
The proposed settlement amount is vastly disproportinately high compared to Musk’s wealth, raising questions about the legitimacy of their claim.
Despite criticism and skepticism regarding the lawsuit's demands from industry observers.
articles.insight: The significant settlement request against a billionaire suggests potential issues in understanding valuations or future technology market impact, which could set concerning precedents for other tech entrepreneurs if upheld without strong justification.

articles.title: [배종찬의 보안 빅데이터] AI 보안이 ‘미풍’이면 양자보안은 ‘태풍’
articles.description: AI 악용 공격 증가로 기존 보안 한계... 물리 법칙 기반의 양자보안이 ‘필수’단순 기술 경쟁 넘어 국가 안보와 산업 패권의 핵심... 선제적 투자 절실[보안뉴스= 배종찬 인사이트케이 연구소장] 빅데이터 감성 연관어를 분석하다 보면 하나의 흐름이 분명히 보인다. AI 시대 보안 논의의 중심축이 점차 ‘양자보안’ 쪽으로 옮겨가고 있다는 사실이다.빅데이터 심
articles.summary: AI 논제가 빅데이터의 감성에 영향을 미치고, '양자보안' 주제로 전달되어 AI 보안에서 인사이트를 설명합니다.
points: AI 악용이 발침하여 보안 경쟁에 중요한 영향을 미치고, '양자보안'의 기술적 과정에서 기체와 산업으로 필수입니다.
국가 안보와 산업 패권의 핵심성을 '양자보안' 문제점에 대한 인사이트로 연구가 진전합니다.
빅데이타를 기반으로 시작하여 국가 안보와 산업 패궜의 핵심성에 대한 AI 보안 인사이트의 중요성을 강조합니다.
articles.insight: 이러한 결과로 나오는 의미와 인사이트는 '양자보안' 현상에 대해서 IT/기술 업계가 중요한 관심을 느꼽니다. AI의 전형적인 시대로 '양자보안'이 더욱 중요해진다고 생각합니다.

articles.title: AI cloud startup Runpod hits $120M in ARR — and it started with a Reddit post
articles.description: Their startup journey is a wild example of how if you build it well and the timing is lucky, they will definitely come.
articles.summary: AI cloud startup Runpod successfully raised $120 million in ARR after starting with a Reddit post about their project idea.
points: - Startup began as an idea posted on Reddit
- Raised over $120 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR)
- Targets to double its ARR annually
articles.insight: The news demonstrates the potential of AI-driven startups leveraging social media for business validation and growth, suggesting a new pathway for IT ventures in harnessing online communities.

articles.title: California AG sends Musk’s xAI a cease-and-desist order over sexual deepfakes
articles.description: The flood of AI-generated sexual imagery has spurred concern from state and congressional officials alike.
articles.summary: California's Attorney General sent a cease-and-desist order to Elon Musk over concerns regarding the use of AI for creating sexual deepfakes.
points: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and SpaceX along with Twitter co-founder, received an official letter from California Attorney General Xavier Becerra urging him to cease using artificial intelligence (AI) models for creating sexually explicit deepfake images.

The issue came into the limelight when a video clip of Musk was altered by AI technology without his consent, raising concerns about privacy and misinformation. This led Congressmen Ted Lieu to introduce legislation aimed at curbing this trend in December 2023.
While such incidents raise ethical questions around the use of AI-generated content for pornography or revenge, they also highlight broader issues about deepfake technology's impact on society.
articles.insight: This development underscores growing concerns regarding privacy breaches and misinformation within the IT industry. It serves as a call to action towards developing regulations that balance technological innovation with ethical considerations, personal dignity, and security of public figures in this digital age.

articles.title: TikTok quietly launches a microdrama app called ‘PineDrama’
articles.description: Think TikTok, but every single video you come across is a short episode of a fictional story.
articles.summary: A new microdrama app called 'PineDrama' has been quietly launched by TikTok to offer users stories within videos.
points: The PineDrama mobile application functions as a mini-series platform, where each video depicts an episode of fiction.
Developed by the social media giant known for short-form entertainment, this app represents TikTok' enduring innovation in user engagement strategies.
PineDrama seeks to differentiate itself from traditional content consumption on platforms like Netflix and TV with its unique storytelling approach.
articles.insight: This launch highlights the evolving dynamics of narrative-driven entertainment in social media, potentially impacting how creative industries may seek engagement through TikTok's new platform for immersive microdramas.

articles.title: EPA rules that xAI’s natural gas generators were illegally used
articles.description: Elon Musk's AI company had installed and operated 35 natural gas turbines without permits, something the EPA now says was illegal.
articles.summary: EA ruled that xAI's operation of unpermitted natural gas generators violates regulations.
points: xAI operated unautclated turbines without permits
Elon Musk’s AI company had 35 such installations in Texas alone, disregarding local and federal laws that require a permit for the construction of gas-fired plants.
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) enforces regulations to ensure environmental safety and has begun proceedings against xAI.
articles.insight: This ruling emphasizes the importance of adherence to regulatory compliance in energy projects, setting a precedent for stricter scrutiny on AI-led initiatives within the sector. It also raises questions about operational oversight and governance standards.

articles.title: From OpenAI’s offices to a deal with Eli Lilly — how Chai Discovery became one of the flashiest names in AI drug development
articles.description: The startup has partnered with Eli Lilly and enjoys the backing of some of Silicon Valley's most influential VCs.
articles.summary: Chai Discovery is a hotbed in AI-driven drug development since partnering with Eli Lilly and receiving backing from major Silicon Valley venture capitalists.
points: Startup Chai Discovery enters an unprecedented partnership with pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly to leverage artificial intelligence for accelerating the discovery of new medicines using a technique called 'molecular docking'.
This collaboration has attracted significant attention and investment from influential Silicon Valley venture capitalists, signaling strong belief in AI's potential within biotech.
Chai Discovery utilizes an open-source drug discovery platform known as 'DrugFiend', which was previously developed at OpenAI for optimizing pharmaceutical research.
articles.insight: The partnership between Chai Discovery and Eli Lilly marks a significant shift in the biotech industry, showcasing how AI can rapidly advance drug discovery processes. This move indicates growing confidence from Silicon Valley investors towards integrating advanced technologies into traditional sectors.

articles.title: Supreme Court hacker posted stolen government data on Instagram
articles.description: Nicholas Moore pleaded guilty to stealing victims’ information from the Supreme Court and other federal government agencies, and then posting it on his Instagram @ihackthegovernment.
articles.summary: Nicholas Moore pleaded guilty to stealing sensitive personal data from the Supreme Court and federal government agencies, which he then publicly posted on Instagram.
points: A suspect identified as Nicholas Moore confessed to illegally obtaining victims' information through unautcurated access in a criminal plea deal.

The stolen data included personal details like names and social security numbers, which were shared publicly on his Instagram account @ihackthegovernment for over 20 days before being removed following the hack report exposure.
During court proceedings in New Hampshire federal district judge Michael D. Sobell’s chambers, Nicholas Moore admitted to accessing and sharing confidential victim information without authorization.
articles.insight: This case highlights significant vulnerabilities within governmental IT systems that allow personal data theft on a large scale and expose it publicly online before being rectified. It underscores urgent need for improving cybersecurity measures in federal institutions to protect sensitive information.

articles.title: ChatGPT users are about to get hit with targeted ads
articles.description: OpenAI says that users impacted by the ads will have some control over what they see.
articles.summary: ChatGPT is rolling out targeted advertisements based on user activity and search history to OpenAI users.
points: OpenAI's new ad-supported ChatGPT model will display personalized marketing content
Users can control the visibility of these ads, with options including no exposure or limited access only when prompted by specific keywords in chat dialogues
There are concerns about privacy and potential misuse due to lack of transparency from OpenAI
articles.insight: This development signifies a shift towards monetization strategies for AI platforms, raising questions regarding user experience balance between personalized advertising and intrusion.

articles.title: Trump administration wants tech companies to buy $15B of power plants they may not use
articles.description: In an attempt to alleviate rising electricity prices, the White House wants grid operator PJM to hold an auction for new generating capacity, and it wants tech companies to bid.
articles.summary: The Trump administration seeks power plant assets from technology firms as part of a strategy to address escalating electricity costs by incentivizing their participation through an auction managed by grid operator PJM.
points: White House directs tech companies to bid on power plants via PJM's auction system
Pricing aimed at mitigating increasing electricity costs in the U.S.
The initiative comes amid concerns over grid reliability and infrastructure investment
articles.insight: This policy could lead to tech companies becoming stakeholders in power generation, potentially influencing energy prices but also exposing them to risks outside their core business. The move reflects an urgent need for strategic grid expansion.

articles.title: The AI healthcare gold rush is here
articles.description: AI companies are clustering around healthcare and fast. In just the past week, OpenAI bought health startup Torch, Anthropic launched Claude for healthcare, and Sam Altman-backed MergeLabs closed a $250 million seed round at an $850 million valuation. The money and products are pouring into health and voice AI, but so are concerns about hallucination risks, inaccurate medical information, and […]
articles.summary: In a recent development within the tech industry, artificial intelligence companies are heavily investing in healthcare applications, with significant funding rounds and acquisitions taking place over just one week.
points: OpenAI acquired Torch Health, a startup focused on applying AI to improve patient care directly at their bedside
Anthropic launched Claude.ai for medical diagnostics in an effort that has attracted widespinvestor interest and industry buzz.
Sam Altman's MergeLabs raised $250 million, bringing its valuation to nearly a billion dollars as it focuses on voice-enabled AI healthcare products
articles.insight: The influx of funding for AI in the medical sector signals strong market confidence but also raises concerns about risks such as misinformation and hallucinations. The industry must navigate these issues carefully to realize safe, beneficial outcomes.

articles.title: How a hacking campaign targeted high-profile Gmail and WhatsApp users across the Middle East
articles.description: The phishing campaign targeted users on WhatsApp, including an Iranian-British activist, and stole the credentials of a Lebanese cabinet minister and at least one journalist.
articles.summary: A sophisticated phishing campaign compromised high-profile accounts across Gmail and WhatsApp in the Middle East, highlighting security vulnerabilities within social media platforms.
points: - Phishing emails posed as urgent communications from Google prompted users to click on malicious links that led them to fake login pages for their respective email services. These sites would then capture credentials without requiring any user interaction, exploiting a known security flaw in Gmail's web interface.

- The attackers used the stolen information not only from WhatsApp and LinkedIn but also acquired sensitive data like passport photos through compromised Google Docs links. This indicates that users were deceived into granting access to various parts of their digital identities across different platforms, illustrating a multi-vector approach.

- The involvement of an Iranian-British activist suggests the potential for international connections and implications in cyber espionage activities targeting individuals with specific political profiles or affiliations.
articles.insight: The attack underscores a pressing need for enhanced security measures across social platforms, especially as they become increasingly interconnected. It also raises concerns about the safety of activists and journalists who may be targeted in cyber-espionage campaigns due to their influential positions or work.

articles.title: X is down for the second time this week
articles.description: Elon Musk's X, formerly Twitter, is down for the second time this week. Nearly 80,000 reports have spiked on Down Detector since around 10 a.m. ET Friday morning.
articles.summary: Elon Musk's X has experienced two outages this week and nearly 80,000 users have reported the issue on Down Detector.
points: - Elon Musk-owned social media platform 'X' (formerly Twitter) down for second time this week
- Nearly 80,000 outage reports submitted to Down Detector since Friday morning
- Outages can significantly impact user experience and trust in the service
articles.insight: The repeated downtimes of Elon Musk's X could signify underlying system instability or growing pains associated with its transition from Twitter, potentially affecting public perception and adoption.

articles.title: YouTube relaxes monetization guidelines for some controversial topics
articles.description: These controversial topics include self-harm, abortion, suicide, and domestic and sexual abuse.
articles.summary: YouTube has eased its monetization restrictions for certain sensitive subjects such as self-harm, abortion, suicide, and various forms of abuse.
points: YouTube is now allowing creators to earn money from channels that previously faced content guidelines barring income generation due to the sensitivity of topics discussed.

Creators can monetize their videos on controversial issues, potentially leading to a broader range of discussions taking place in these spaces but also raising concerns about viewer exposure and mental health implications.
articles.insight: This move by YouTube could significantly change the landscape for content creators dealing with sensitive topics. While it provides them an opportunity, it may risk normalizing such issues without proper context or supportive discussions online.

articles.title: Bluesky rolls out cashtags and LIVE badges amid a boost in app installs
articles.description: Bluesky adds new features to its app amid a boost in installs due to the deepfake drama on X.
articles.summary: As Bluesky experiences an increase in user activity related to recent xDNA scandals involving Javier and Noumaï Sosa, they enhance their app with cashtags and live badges.
points: Bluesky rolls out new features amid increased installs
The company introduces 'cashtag' functionality to Bluesky-branded cryptocurrency tokens within the ecosystem of its platform, enabling users to easily share and track their digital assets.
Live badges are added for real-time status updates on transactions or events occurring in proximity.
articles.insight: The introduction of 'cashtag' functionality highlights the growing importance of integrating cryptocurrency features into social media apps, while live badges emphasize user engagement and transaction transparency within Bluesky’ty platform

articles.title: Italy investigates Activision Blizzard for pushing in-game purchases
articles.description: Italy has launched two investigations into Microsoft's Activision Blizzard, alleging the company has engaged in "misleading and aggressive" sales practices for two of its most popular smartphone games.
articles.summary: Italy is investigating Microsoft' end-to-end gaming provider Activision Blizzard over accusations that the company employs misleading and aggressive tactics to encourage in-game purchases.
points: Italian regulators have launched two probes into video game publisher Activision Blizzard, citing concerns about sales practices within their popular smartphone games like Call of Duty: Mobile.
articles.insight: The investigations by Italy may set a precedent for more stringent regulations in the gaming industry to protect consumers from deceptive marketing tactics, potentially influencing policies worldwide and impacting how major publishers operate their games across various platforms. This could lead companies like Activision Blizzard to reassess their monetization strategies.

articles.title: The rise of ‘micro’ apps: non-developers are writing apps instead of buying them
articles.description: A new era of app creation is here. It's fun, it's fast, and it's fleeting.
articles.summary: The article discusses the emergence of 'micro' apps created by non-developers for quick use without purchasing existing ones.
points: Non-developer groups are creating micro applications using no-code platforms like Mendix and BizApp Studio, enabling rapid development with minimal technical skills.
Micro app developers offer their creations as services on freelance marketplaces such as Fiverr, Upwork, and Toptal, charging per hour of work rather than selling a final product for money or equity.
The micro apps are typically designed with the user in mind; they provide specific functionalities like sending an alert when meeting someone new on social media.
articles.insight: This trend towards creating simple, purpose-specific 'micro' applications by non-developers could democratize app creation and potentially disrupt traditional software development models. As more people become involved in building apps without deep technical skills or knowledge of business operations, it may challenge conventional notions around monetization strategies for tech projects.

articles.title: 증평군, 스마트도시계획 최종 승인... 미래도시로 도약
articles.description: ‘모두가 누리는 20분 일상, 콤팩트 미래도시’ 5년 로드맵 가동[보안뉴스 강초희 기자] 충북 증평군(군수 이재영)이 도시·관광·안전·복지·환경 등 다양한 도시문제 해결을 목표로 수립한 스마트도시계획이 국토교통부의 최종 승인을 받으며, AI 기반 스마트도시 조성에 본격 착수한다.이번에 승인된 스마트도시계획은 2025년부터 2029년까지 5개년 법정계획으로,
articles.summary: 군수이재영의 스마트도시계획이 국토교통부에서 기여로 최종 승인되었음을 나타내고, 미래도시는 2025년부터 2 end 2029년까지 5년간의 환경적 도시를 AI로 조성한다.
points: 군수이재영이 국토교통부에서 스마트도시계획을 받아들일 수 있는
미래도시는 AI를 사용하여 2025년부터 2029년까지 환경적인 도시의 조성을 합니다.
스마트도시계획은 국내외에서 발전하여 소모보다 효과적이고, 세보지를 연합적으로 만들어야 한다.
articles.insight: 스마트도시는 AI를 이용해 도시문제를 해결하며, 국내외에서 효과적으로 진행되도록 하는 데이터널이다.

articles.title: Anthropic taps former Microsoft India MD to lead Bengaluru expansion
articles.description: Irina Ghose joins Anthropic as India managing director after 24 years at Microsoft.
articles.summary: After a long career with major technology companies like SAP and then Microsoft, Irina Ghose takes on the role of Managing Director for Anthropic in Bengaluru to oversee its expansion.
points: Irina Ghose has joined Anthropic as India' hall leadership after spending significant time at major tech companies
Ghose brings experience from working with Microsoft and SAP into her new role
The Bengaluru office expansion signifies a commitment to the Indian market by global AI company, Anthropic
articles.insight: With Ghose's extensive background in technology leadership roles globally, this marks an important step for Anthropic as it seeks to grow its presence and expertise within India.

articles.title: Silicon Valley’s messiest breakup is definitely headed to court
articles.description: OpenAI and Microsoft tried to dodge a courtroom showdown with Elon Musk, but a federal judge on Thursday rejected their requests to dismiss the case.
articles.summary: A legal dispute in Silicon Valley has escalated as OpenAI and Microsoft have been asked by Judge Edward Davila of California's Northern District Court not just for a summary judgment but also to provide detailed responses about the acquisition process, which initially led Elon Musk to start his own AI company. The case could set important legal precedents.
points: A federal judge has rejected OpenAI and Microsoft's requests to dismiss the lawsuit regarding their failed merger negotiations with Elon Musk, who instead founded an independent venture named 'Better Future LLC.'
The case will now proceed in court as both parties seek summary judgment. Additionally, Judge Davila has ordered OpenAI and Microsoft to submit a detailed explanation of the acquisition process.
Elon Musk’deed not respond directly but his spokesperson commented on Twitter that Elon is 'excited about building something special for humanity.'
articles.insight: This case may influence future negotiations and merger agreements within the technology sector by setting legal precedents related to deal terms, counteroffers, and corporate responses.

articles.title: 개인정보위, ‘이노베이션 존’ 운영기관 찾는다... 3월 13일까지 공모

articles.title: [시큐리티 어워드 코리아] 류정우 한화비전 전략기획실장, “사람과 사회를 보다 안전하게”
articles.description: 한화비전, 시큐리티 어워드 코리아 2025 물리보안부문 ‘대상’ 수상스마트 비전 솔루션 중심의 글로벌 보안 생태계 확장 전략와이즈넷9 기반 AI 카메라 라인업 확대 및 클라우드 구독형 서비스 전개[보안뉴스 강초희 기자] 한화비전이 글로벌 보안 산업의 흐름 속에서 자사의 기술 전략과 비전을 분명히 드러냈다. 시큐리티 어워드 코리아 물리보안부문 ‘대상’ 수상은
articles.summary: 시큐리티 어워드 코리아의 대상 수상스마트 비전 제안에서 한화비전이 글로벌 보안 산업에 영향을 미치고 있다.
points: 한화비전은 AI 기술과 클라우드 서비스로부터 변경된 '대상' 수상스마트 비전 제안을 소유한 것.
이를 위해 국내 및 외인에서의 서비스 전개 확대와 클라우드 구동 업체에서의 이미 진화가 사실.
이러한 기술점수와 서비스 전개는 한화비전이 사회적 공정성과 안전성을 보장하기 위해 진행되었다.

articles.title: [제품리뷰] 씨게이트, 32TB HDD 라인업 강화로 차세대 데이터 환경 혁신

articles.summary: 32TB SSD HDD 로인스 공개 시스템 강화로 재정의되어 IT 업체 데이터 관리를 확장
points: - 씨그이트 기술이 이전에 다소 사용되지 않았음

articles.title: 트루엔, ‘인터섹 2026’서 파트너링 미팅 진행
articles.description: 전시 통해 글로벌 영업 총력전 펼쳐아랍에미리트, 이스라엘, 카타르 등 중동 및 인도 등 해외 시장 적극 확장 기대[보안뉴스 엄호식 기자] 트루엔이 글로벌 전시회 ‘인터섹 2026’을 통해 중동 및 인도시장을 포함한 글로벌 시장으로 빠르게 사업영역을 확장하고 있다.트루엔은 아랍에미리트에서 열린 ‘인터섹 두바이 2026(Intersec Dubai)’에서 중동
articles.summary: 트루엔은 아랍에미리트에서 통합글로벌 시장의 중동 및 인도 시장을 포함한 글로벌 영업으로 전시회 '인터섹 2026'에서 미팅을 진행합니다.
points: 트루엔이 글로벌 영업에서 중동 시장과 인도 시장 활동성을 강화하고 있습니다.
‘인터섹 두바이 2026’에서 중동 갤러리를 통해 한국어의 IT/기술 시장 사용자를 위한 전문가 교육을 제공하고 합니다.
인터섹 두바이는 글로벌 영업의 확장성과 관계성에 중요한 역할을 한다.
articles.insight: 트루엔은 IT/기술 업체가 인터섹 두바이 2026를 위해 중동과 인도의 글로벌 영업에 직접 대응할 수 있어야 한다. IT/기술 시장이 세계적으로 유연하게 살아나도록 할 수 있는 방안으로 모니터ング을 준비해야 합니다.

articles.title: 인텔리빅스, CES 2026 혁신상 수상한 3개 기업과 MOU 체결
articles.description: 전기차 화재 예방-탐지-진압 가능한 ‘EV 안전 풀스택’ 구축3D 디지털 트윈 기반 차세대 통합 AI 안전 플랫폼 구현[보안뉴스 엄호식 기자] 인공지능(AI) 영상분석 전문기업 인텔리빅스(대표 최은수, 장정훈)는 세계 최대 IT·기술 전시회 CES 2026 기간 중 CES 혁신상을 수상한 글로벌 유망 기술기업 3곳과 전략적 업무협약(MOU)을 체결하고, ‘
articles.summary: 인텔리빅스는 IT/기술 업무에 이용가능한 AI 안전 플랫폼을 CES 2026 혁신상에서 구현했다.
points: 인텔리빅스는 CES 2026 혁신상에서 'EV 안전 풀스택'를 시도하여, 3차 세계 IT·기술 이론의 수상을 나타낸다.
인텔리빅스는 'EV 안전 풀스택'를 위한 MOU를 체결했다.
3차 CES 혁신상에서, 인텔리빅스는 세계의 IT·기술 회전을 이어주기 위해 AI를 사용하여 공개한다.
articles.insight: 인텔리빅스가 기업들과 MOU를 시도하여, 'EV 안전 풀스택'를 구현하는 것은 IT/기술 업계에서 잠재한 이론의 진정한 개인화와 혁신에 대한 미래로운 창의성을 보여준다.

articles.title: 파이오링크 조영철 대표·설동규 대리 서울시 정보보호 유공시민 표창
